src:
Partizan dočekuje Veneciju, debituje Bel?
04 Nov 2019, 13:45 by Darko
Košarkaši Partizana u utorak od 20 časova, u Štark areni, dočekuju Veneciju u 6. kolu Evrokupa. Crno-beli imaju maksimalan učinak u prvih pet kola, dok šampion Italije ima tri pobede i dva poraza.
Pred sutrašnji duel, trener Partizana NIS, Andrea Trinkijeri je izjavio:
– Veoma zanimljiva utakmica je pred nama. U Veneciji smo odigrali izuzetno čvrst meč i tada smo imali priliku da osetimo koliko dobar može biti tim protiv kojeg igramo. Imaju iskusne igrače, talentovane igrače i sigurno je da će dati sve od sebe da pruže svoj maksimum protiv nas. Sa druge strane, mi znamo šta treba da radimo u našoj kući, pred našim navijačima, rekao je Trinkijeri.
Novi igrač crno-belih Džejms Bel u ponedeljak je doputovao u Beograd. On će se posle obavljenih lekarskih pregleda priključiti ekipi na večernjem treningu, a Trinkijeri će odlučiti da li će i debitovati protiv Venecije.
Bek crno-belih, Ognjen Jaramaz je povodom sutrašnjeg meča izjavio:
– Venecija je veoma dobar tim, sa puno iskusnih igrača. U prvom kolu smo sa odigrali neizvestan meč i moramo biti svesni da će i sutrašnja utakmica biti veliki izazov za nas. Prva polovina grupne faze Evrokupa je za nas bila veoma dobra i daćemo sve od sebe da nastavimo u tom pravcu, istakao je Jaramaz.
Prodaja ulaznica za sutrašnji meč, odvija se na sledećim lokacijama:
04.11. Ticketline Novi Beograd, Bulevar Milutina Milankovića 1 (iza Medigrup bolnice) od 10 do 18 časova
05.11. Ticketline Novi Beograd, Bulevar Milutina Milankovića 1 (iza Medigrup bolnice) od 10 do 16 časova i Štark Arena (Jug) od 16 časova do početka utakmice
Cene pojedinačnih ulaznica za utakmicu protiv Venecije su:
Tribina (Nivo 400): 400 dinaraTribina (Nivo 200): 600 dinaraParter: 1.000 dinaraStandard 2: 800 dinaraStandard 1: 1.000 dinaraSuperior: 1.400 dinara

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Partizan welcomes Venice, Bell debuts?
04 Nov 2019, 12:45 by Darko
Partizan Basketball players will welcome Venice in the 6th round of the Eurocup on Tuesday at 8 pm at the Stark Arena. Black and whites have maximum performance in the first five rounds, while the Italian champion has three wins and two losses.
Before tomorrow's match, Partisan NIS coach Andrea Trinkijeri stated:
- A very interesting match is ahead. In Venice we played an extremely solid match and at that time we had the opportunity to feel how good the team we can play against can be. They have experienced players, talented players and it is certain that they will do their best to do their utmost against us. On the other hand, we know what we need to do in our house, in front of our fans, Trinkieri said.
New Black and White player James Bell arrives in Belgrade on Monday. He will join the team in the evening after his medical examinations, and Trinkier will decide whether to make his debut against Venice.
Black-and-white back, Ognjen Jaramaz said in a statement on tomorrow's match:
- Venice is a very good team, with a lot of experienced players. In the first round we played an uncertain match and we have to be aware that tomorrow's game will be a big challenge for us. The first half of the group stage of Eurocup was very good for us and we will do our best to continue in this direction, Jaramaz stressed.
Ticket sales for tomorrow's match take place at the following locations:
04.11. Ticketline New Belgrade, Milutina Milankovic Boulevard 1 (behind Medigrup Hospital) from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.
05.11. Ticketline New Belgrade, Milutina Milankovic Boulevard 1 (behind Medigrup Hospital) from 10am to 4pm and Stark Arena (South) from 4pm to the start of the match
Single ticket prices for the match against Venice are:
Grandstand (Level 400): 400 dinarsTribina (Level 200): 600 dinarsParter: 1,000 dinarsStandard 2: 800 dinarsStandard 1: 1,000 dinarsSuperior: 1,400 dinars
